the Library of Virginia 24672

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fishback Family Ledger, 1818-1896. Accession 24672, Business records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Lent for copying by Mrs. F.R. Chamberlain, 9 October 1957.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Fishback family resided near The Plains in Fauquier County, Virginia, and were engaged in the sale of general merchandise and the operaration of a blacksmith shop. The volume contains entries made by Nelson N. Fishback (ca. 1778-1823) and his sons Josiah T. (b. 1819) and John N. Fishback (1823-1871). Entries made by John N. Fishback, Jr. (1871-1911) also appear. For additional information concerning the family, consult Willis M. Kemper, comp., Genealogy of the Fishback Family in America (New York: Thomas Madison Taylor, 1914).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Ledger includes entries by members of the Fishback family of Fauquier County, Virginia, concerning sales of general merchandise, and charges for blacksmith work performed (1859-1866). Also contains accounts relating to a farm (1868-1896); an employment agreement and family records (1814-1895); and slave records (1810-1823). Partly indexed.
